1.name: My Fair Lady
1.description: A snobbish phonetics professor agrees to a wager that he can make a flower girl presentable in high society.

2.name: Mary Poppins
2.description: In turn of the century London, a magical nanny employs music and adventure to help two neglected children become closer to their father.

3.name: Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb
3.description: An insane general triggers a path to nuclear holocaust that a War Room full of politicians and generals frantically tries to stop.

4.name: Per un pugno di dollari
4.description: A wandering gunfighter plays two rival families against each other in a town torn apart by greed, pride, and revenge.

5.name: Goldfinger
5.description: While investigating a gold magnate's smuggling, James Bond uncovers a plot to contaminate the Fort Knox gold reserve.

6.name: The Moon-Spinners
6.description: Travelling through Crete to collect folk songs for the BBC, a British teen and her aunt stumble upon local criminals who are peddling gems stolen from a London bank.

7.name: A Hard Day's Night
7.description: Over two "typical" days in the life of The Beatles, the boys struggle to keep themselves and Paul McCartney's mischievous grandfather in check while preparing for a live television performance.

8.name: Marnie
8.description: Mark marries Marnie although she is a habitual thief and has serious psychological problems, and tries to help her confront and resolve them.

9.name: Zulu
9.description: Outnumbered British soldiers do battle with Zulu warriors at Rorke's Drift.

10.name: Muscle Beach Party
10.description: Local beach-goers find that their beach has been taken over by a businessman training a stable of body builders.

11.name: The Train
11.description: In 1944, a German colonel loads a train with French art treasures to send to Germany. The Resistance must stop it without damaging the cargo.

12.name: Suna no onna
12.description: An entomologist on vacation is trapped by local villagers into living with a woman whose life task is shoveling sand for them.

13.name: Hush...Hush, Sweet Charlotte
13.description: An aging, reclusive Southern belle plagued by a horrifying family secret descends into madness after the arrival of a lost relative.

14.name: Les parapluies de Cherbourg
14.description: A young woman separated from her lover by war faces a life-altering decision.

15.name: Father Goose
15.description: During World War II, a man persuaded to live on an isolated island and spot aircraft finds himself responsible for a teacher and several students, all female.

16.name: A Shot in the Dark
16.description: Inspector Jacques Clouseau investigates the murder of Mr. Benjamin Ballon's driver at a country estate.

17.name: The Killers
17.description: Surprised that their contract victim didn't try to run away from them, two professional hit men try to find out who hired them and why.

18.name: Alexis Zorbas
18.description: An uptight English writer travelling to Crete, on a matter of business, finds his life changed forever when he meets the gregarious Alexis Zorba.

19.name: Topkapi
19.description: A conman gets mixed up with a group of thieves who plan to rob an Istanbul museum to retrieve a jewelled dagger.

20.name: The Fall of the Roman Empire
20.description: The death of Marcus Aurelius leads to a succession crisis, in which the deceased emperor's son, Commodus, demonstrates that he is unwilling to let anything undermine his claim to the Roman Empire.

21.name: Kaidan
21.description: A collection of four Japanese folk tales with supernatural themes.

22.name: The Night of the Iguana
22.description: A defrocked Episcopal clergyman leads a bus-load of middle-aged Baptist women on a tour of the Mexican coast and comes to terms with the failure haunting his life.

23.name: Emil and the Detectives
23.description: Emil goes to Berlin to see his grandmother with a large amount of money and is offered sweets by a strange man that make him sleep. He wakes up at his stop with no money. It is up to him and a group of children to save the day.

24.name: Seven Days in May
24.description: United States military leaders plot to overthrow the President because he supports a nuclear disarmament treaty and they fear a Soviet sneak attack.

25.name: Bullet for a Badman
25.description: Former Texas Rangers Sam Ward and Logan Keliher become enemies when Sam turns bank robber and Logan marries Sam's ex-wife.

26.name: Goodbye Charlie
26.description: Shot by a jealous husband, Charley falls out a porthole and is lost at sea only to find himself returned as an attractive blond woman. His best friend is staying at his house as he puts ...                See full summary »

27.name: Becket
27.description: King Henry II of England comes to terms with his affection for his close friend and confidant Thomas Becket, who finds his true honor by observing God's divine will rather than the King's.

28.name: 6 donne per l'assassino
28.description: A masked, shadowy killer brutally murders the models of a scandalous fashion house in Rome.

29.name: Fail-Safe
29.description: American planes are sent to deliver a nuclear attack on Moscow, but it's a mistake due to an electrical malfunction. Can all-out war be averted?

30.name: The Incredible Mr. Limpet
30.description: Meek and mild mannered bookkeeper Henry Limpet has few passions in life. It's mid-1941 and he would love to join the Navy but has been rated 4F. His friend George Stickle is in the Navy and...                See full summary »

31.name: The Last Man on Earth
31.description: When a disease turns all of humanity into the living dead, the last man on earth becomes a reluctant vampire hunter.

32.name: The Masque of the Red Death
32.description: A European prince terrorizes the local peasantry while using his castle as a refuge against the "Red Death" plague that stalks the land.

33.name: Il deserto rosso
33.description: In an industrial area, Giuliana, an unstable woman, attempts to cope with life by starting an affair with a co-worker at the plant her husband manages.

34.name: First Men in the Moon
34.description: When a spaceship lands on the moon, it is hailed as a new accomplishment, before it becomes clear that a Victorian party completed the journey in 1899, leading investigators to that mission's last survivor.

35.name: The Quick Gun
35.description: Gunslinger Clint Cooper returns to his hometown to help fight off a raid by his former gang.

36.name: Onibaba
36.description: Two women kill samurai and sell their belongings for a living. While one of them is having an affair with their neighbor, the other woman meets a mysterious samurai wearing a bizarre mask.

37.name: The Pawnbroker
37.description: A Jewish pawnbroker, victim of Nazi persecution, loses all faith in his fellow man until he realizes too late the tragedy of his actions.

38.name: Matrimonio all'italiana
38.description: The rich man Domenico and Filumena, a penniless prostitute, share great part of their lives in the immediate post WWII Italy.

39.name: What a Way to Go!
39.description: A four-time widow discusses her four marriages, in which all of her husbands became incredibly rich and died prematurely because of their drive to be rich.

40.name: Carry On Cleo
40.description: Two Britons are captured and enslaved by invading Romans and taken to Rome. Hengist Pod creates useless inventions, while Horsa is a brave and cunning fighter. One of their first encounters...                See full summary »

41.name: Paris - When It Sizzles
41.description: The sprightly young assistant of a Hollywood screenwriter helps him over his writer's block by acting out his fantasies of possible plots.

42.name: Viva Las Vegas
42.description: Race car driver Lucky Jackson goes to Las Vegas to earn money to pay for a new engine for his motor car. Working as a waiter, he still finds the time to court young Rusty Martin.

43.name: Man's Favorite Sport?
43.description: The author of a best-selling fishing guide is actually incredibly inexperienced when it comes to the sport, which causes mayhem when he is entered into a competition.

44.name: Send Me No Flowers
44.description: A hypochondriac believes he is dying and makes plans for his wife which she discovers and misunderstands.

45.name: The Naked Kiss
45.description: Kelly, a prostitute, traumatised by an experience, referred to as 'The Naked Kiss,' by psychiatrists, leaves her past, and finds solace in the town of Grantville. She meets Griff, the ...                See full summary »

46.name: Fate Is the Hunter
46.description: An airline executive refuses to believe that pilot error by his friend caused a fatal crash, and persists in looking for another reason.

47.name: Dead Ringer
47.description: The working-class twin sister of a callous, wealthy woman impulsively murders her out of revenge and assumes her identity. But impersonating her dead twin is more complicated and risky than she anticipated.

48.name: Il vangelo secondo Matteo
48.description: The life of Jesus Christ according to the Gospel of Matthew. Pasolini shows Christ as a Marxist avant-la-lettre and therefore uses half of the text of Matthew.

49.name: Mosura tai Gojira
49.description: A greedy developer unwittingly hatches a gigantic baby moth upon Tokyo, while Godzilla strikes once again.

50.name: Robinson Crusoe on Mars
50.description: Stranded on Mars with only a monkey as a companion, an astronaut must figure out how to find oxygen, water, and food on the lifeless planet.
